verses.text: The Spirit of the Lord \sc God\sc* \add is\add* upon me; Because the \sc Lord\sc* hath anointed me to preach good tidings unto the meek; He hath sent me to bind up the broken-hearted, To proclaim liberty to the captives, And the opening of the prison to \add them that are\add* bound;
To proclaim the acceptable year of the \sc Lord\sc*, And the day of vengeance of our God; To comfort all that mourn;

To appoint unto them that mourn in Zion, To give unto them beauty for ashes, The oil of joy for mourning, The garment of praise for the spirit of heaviness; That they might be called trees of righteousness, The planting of the \sc Lord\sc*, that \add he\add* might be glorified.
And they shall build the old wastes, They shall raise up the former desolations, And they shall repair the waste cities, The desolations of many generations.
And strangers shall stand and feed your flocks, And the sons of the alien \add shall be\add* your plowmen and your vinedressers.
But ye shall be named the Priests of the \sc Lord\sc*: \add Men\add* shall call you the Ministers of our God: Ye shall eat the riches of the Gentiles, And in their glory shall you boast yourselves.

For your shame \add you shall have\add* double; And \add for\add* confusion they shall rejoice in their portion: Therefore in their land they shall possess the double: Everlasting joy shall be unto them.
For I the \sc Lord\sc* love judgment, I hate robbery for burnt offering; And I will direct their work in truth, And I will make an everlasting covenant with them.

And their seed shall be known among the Gentiles, And their offspring among the people: All that see them shall acknowledge them, That they \add are\add* the seed \add which\add* the \sc Lord\sc* hath blessed.

I will greatly rejoice in the \sc Lord\sc*, My soul shall be joyful in my God; For he hath clothed me with the garments of salvation, He hath covered me with the robe of righteousness, As a bridegroom decketh \add himself\add* with ornaments, And as a bride adorneth \add herself\add* with her jewels.

For as the earth bringeth forth her bud, And as the garden causeth the things that are sown in it to spring forth; So the Lord \sc God\sc* will cause righteousness and praise to spring forth Before all the nations.
